title: When does it start to show that Naruto likes Hinata? (If it ever happens) - Quora

response.answer_text: Their connection actually starts in a flashback in The Last: Naruto the Movie. Hinata was being bullied by a bunch of kids when Naruto stepped in and defended her, getting beaten up instead in the process. This moment was the reason why Hinata started to admire Naruto. He got his red scarf torn up in the scuffle but shrugged it off. Hinata, however, wanted to repay his kindness and from then on, she started watching him from afar. In an episode near the end of the Part 2, we get to see a similar scene of Hinata getting bullied with Naruto saving the day, this time he had no scarf because it was already torn in the earlier scuffle. There were also scenes in flashback episodes near the end of Part 2 that showed them in the academy. In a sparring match between Sasuke and Naruto, all the girls were cheering for the former. Only one person was cheering for Naruto albeit discreetly: Hinata. In Part 1, specifically the written portion of the Chunin Exams, Hinata wanted to let Naruto copy answers from her, to which he declined because he would never take advantage of her. After his victory against Kiba, Hinata mustered the courage to offer Naruto some healing ointment. Naruto being thick-headed that he is, accepted the offer since he knows Hinata is always sincere. In the battle between Neji and Hinata, Naruto was amazed with her for not backing down despite clearly being outclassed. When Hinata was beaten to near death by her cousin and was mocked for being weak, Naruto swore a blood oath to Hinata that he will beat Neji. This lead to training under Jiraiya and Ebisu. The day before the match, Hinata encouraged Naruto that although he may stumble and fall, he will always find a way to get back up, calling him her “proud failure” (one way of saying he is her inspiration). Naruto replied that although she may be a bit weird, he really likes her (at least people like her). After defeating Neji and the crowd started cheering for him, the first person he looked for recognition was none other than Hinata, whom he made a promise. There were filler episodes that involved Naruto and Team 8, and the dynamic between him and Hinata. One such was the Bikochu Beetle arc. In one episode, Naruto saw Hinata practicing on the water. Naruto called her beautiful, although he didn't know that it was Hinata that he saw. All in all, Part 1 laid a somewhat decent foundation for the pair despite being very subtle. It is in part two that their relationship has some very interesting interactions. Naruto and Hinata's relationship in Part 2 was pretty much the same in Part 1 until we reached the Konoha Invasion Arc. Pain destroyed the village and fought Naruto, nearly defeating him. Hinata stepped in and fought Pain regardless of the fact that she was powerless against him. She focused on freeing Naruto from the metal rods that pinned him down but ultimately, she was beaten and stabbed. This happened in Episode 166 (I think?) and was titled Confessions. Seeing Hinata cut down like that and “killed” caused him to snap. This unleashed his tailed-beast cloak, nearly reaching the full form of the Nine-tailed fox. After Pain's defeat, he was come with grief that he lost control again and that he thought he killed Hinata and destroyed the village. When he used Sage mode to sense everyone's chakra, he was relieved that Hinata was still alive and that he didn't kill her by accident (it was shown in the manga that he was gripping his chest and nearly crying for her safety). Their interaction was put on hold because of some important events (Danzo Shimura seizing power and the Fourth Great Shinobi War, etc.) During his meeting with the Great Toad Sage at Mount Miyoboku, he was apprehensive about using the Nine-tail's power because he might lose control again. We won't see any development in their relationship again during the events of the war until Neji's sacrifice. With his beliefs broken by Obito's remarks on how he wasn't able to save Neji, Hinata was the one who slapped some sense into him. She reminded Naruto of her cousin's sacrifice, that his life is no longer his, and also of their shared ninja creed. Kurama agreed with Hinata, saying that Naruto owes his life also to his parent's sacrifice. Now encouraged, Naruto held Hinata's hand and stood together side by side and activated his tailed-beast form, empowering Hinata with the same chakra as seem in the anime and the cover of Vol. 64. Now, after that scene, the events that followed focused more on the battle between the Allied Shinobi Forces vs Madara and Obito Uchiha using the Ten-tails. There was a key event that showed they had a subtle yet strong bond between them. When the Infinite Tsukuyomi was activated and the world's population was beginning to be trapped in genjutsu, Hinata called out Naruto's name subconsciously. Naruto was able to sense this and immediately rushed to her but was stopped by Sasuke. After that arc, we didn't see anything else between the two of them before the events of The Last, which we no longer need to discuss since the main premise of the movie was the two of them. Personally, I believe that Naruto already had feelings for Hinata albeit subconsciously. Even so, he was too dense to realize this. Psychologically, Naruto was never able to experience actual love. To him, loving someone romantically can just be the same as loving ramen. Teuchi and Iruka Umino were the first people to accept Naruto, but it was Hinata who actually loved him the first which is apparent. Naruto on the other hand, developed his feelings subconsciously for Hinata in what I would guess was when he was encouraged by Hinata before his fight with Neji. He heard from Hinata herself that despite his flaws, she was proud of him. This might've formed the foundation for Naruto and Hinata's relationship. For the first time, someone besides Iruka acknowledged him for who he is. This event might've engrained itself in his psyche since the other people only see him as an annoyance. For me, this was the spark that lit Naruto's love for Hinata. In this same scene, we actually hear Naruto say that he likes people similar to Hinata. It might not be much, but Naruto has already acknowledged Hinata for who she is too. We have observed from previous parts throughout the anime and manga that Naruto loses control if angered. He has shown this when Sasuke betrayed the Hidden Leaf Village. The same condition can also be said to his fight with Orochimaru. Sasuke was treated as property by the villain and Naruto just lost it. The only other person that caused him to snap was Hinata. Her supposed death is what triggered the near perfect transformation to the Nine-tails. She was stabbed right in front of him, and he witnessed blood gushing out of her body. Compared to other transformations, we've never seen Naruto become so enraged and powerful in this scale. It simply shows that deep down, Hinata is the most important person in his life, he just doesn't realize it yet. And after the rampage, the first person he looked for was Hinata. He was afraid that she might've died by his hands during his rampage. When he was reassured of her safety, he almost cried while clutching his chest. Had she actually died, Naruto wouldn't just kill Pain, but turn the Hidden Leaf Village into a chakra irradiated hole. Finally we have the scene when the Infinite Tsukuyomi was activated. When Hinata called for Naruto, it was subconsciously, and Naruto heard it. It's as if they are connected together. This might just be because out of all the characters during the war, Hinata received the most chakra since she held the hand of the actual Naruto for the longest time and not just a shadow clone, although this is just my speculation. I would love to hear your comments on my analysis and idea behind Naruto and Hinata's relationship. If you have any other things to share or correct, feel free to do so.
